cards.name: Canopy Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Civic Wayfinder
cards.text: When Civic Wayfinder enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "These alleys are not safe. Come, I can guide you back to the market square."
cards.originalText: When Civic Wayfinder comes into play, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Commune with Nature
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If you don't reveal a creature card, put all the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Craw Wurm
cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.flavor: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.name: Elven Riders
cards.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: "Wirewood cannot hide great size. Only with speed and skill can we survive here."

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

cards.originalText: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.

cards.name: Elvish Berserker
cards.text: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
cards.flavor: Their fury scatters enemies like a pile of dry leaves.
cards.originalText: Whenever Elvish Berserker becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

cards.name: Elvish Champion
cards.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn

rulings.text: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

foreignNames.name: エルフのチャンピオン

cards.originalText: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Elvish Piper
cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand into play.

cards.name: Enormous Baloth
cards.flavor: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

cards.name: Femeref Archers
cards.text: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Bet you can't put it through the eye."
"Left or right?"
cards.originalText: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.

cards.name: Gaea's Herald
cards.text: Creature spells can't be countered.
cards.flavor: "Gaea sings with the voice of nature rampant: a thousand howls, chitters, and cries, and none of them can be ignored."

rulings.text: The ability applies to your opponent's spells as well as your own.

cards.originalText: Creature spells can't be countered.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"When I trained under Multani, he bade me sit for hours watching Yavimaya's spiders. From them I learned stealth, patience, and the best way to snare a wind drake."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor:
"We cannot forget that among all of Dominaria's wonders, a system of life exists, with prey and predators that will never fight wars nor vie for ancient power."
—Jolrael, empress of beasts

cards.name: Hunted Wumpus
cards.text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from their hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.

foreignNames.name: 狩り立てられたウンパス

cards.originalText: When Hunted Wumpus comes into play, each other player may put a creature card from his or her hand into play.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Don't envy the grandeur of drakes. Their impression of grace fades when the first gust sends them crashing into one another."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

cards.name: Joiner Adept
cards.text: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
cards.flavor: A talented apprentice makes all things. The master makes all things possible.

rulings.text: Each land you control gets this ability.

cards.originalText: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Karplusan Strider
cards.text: Karplusan Strider can't be the target of blue or black spells.
cards.flavor: The strider's long, loping gait is an adaptation that allows it to move quickly in deep snow.

foreignNames.name: カープルーザンの徘徊者

cards.originalText: Karplusan Strider can't be the target of blue or black spells.

cards.name: Kavu Climber
cards.text: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"There was a crack of branches, a rustle of leaves, then a tremendous roar. Our party had no chance as death descended from above."
—Taseen, elvish bard
cards.originalText: When Kavu Climber comes into play, draw a card.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Llanowar Sentinel
cards.text: When Llanowar Sentinel enters the battlefield, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, search your library for a card named Llanowar Sentinel and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"The forest has as many eyes as leaves."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

Llanowar Sentinels can "chain": If you put a second Llanowar Sentinel onto the battlefield as a result of this ability, that creature's enters-the-battlefield ability triggers and allows you to search for yet another Llanowar Sentinel.

cards.originalText: When Llanowar Sentinel comes into play, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, search your library for a card named Llanowar Sentinel and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor: Her true theft was to steal the soldiers away from their posts.

rulings.text: Lure doesn't give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that's tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block if that cost isn't paid.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.name: Might of Oaks
cards.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Might Weaver
cards.text: {2}: Target red or white creature gains trample until end of turn. (If the creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: "Let my strength harden your resolve."
cards.originalText: {2}: Target red or white creature gains trample until end of turn. (If it would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)

cards.name: Mirri, Cat Warrior
cards.text: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavor:
"Full of beauty and grace, with a predator's instincts . . . Although she wanders, I have always thought Mirri belongs in Llanowar most of all."
—Rofellos, Llanowar emissary
cards.originalText: First strike, forestwalk, vigilance (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike, it's unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest, and attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
cards.flavor: "My mind is the spread of the canopy. My heart is the embrace of the roots. I am deathless Llanowar, its fury and its peace."

foreignNames.name: マローの魔術師モリモ

cards.originalText:
Trample (If this creature would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

cards.name: Natural Spring
cards.text: Target player gains 8 life.
cards.flavor:
"Jewels cannot be eaten nor gold drunk. What civilization trades, nature simply provides."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer
cards.originalText: Target player gains 8 life.

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Well, it also makes a very nice flower pot. . . ."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Overgrowth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}{G}.
cards.flavor:
"Let the forest spread! From salt, stone, and fen, let the new trees rise."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: This is a triggered mana ability.

cards.originalText:
Enchant land (Target a land as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that land.)
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G}{G} to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Nature doesn't walk.

rulings.text: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn. (If a creature you control would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)

cards.name: Pincher Beetles
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"No fair Since when does a bug get ta munch on me?"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
cards.originalText: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Primal Rage
cards.text: Creatures you control have trample. (If a creature you control would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: Ferocity and cunning accounted for half the victory. Gravity accounted for the rest.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control have trample. (If a creature you control would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)

cards.name: Quirion Dryad
cards.text: Whenever you cast a white, blue, black, or red spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Quirion Dryad.
cards.flavor:
"Never underestimate the ability of natural forces to adapt to unnatural influences."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: Quirion Dryad's ability will trigger only once per spell you cast, as long as that spell is at least one of the listed colors.
Quirion Dryad's ability will trigger if you cast a spell that's green and at least one of the listed colors.

foreignNames.name: クウィリーオンのドライアド

cards.originalText: Whenever you play a white, blue, black, or red spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Quirion Dryad.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Recollect
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"The bones of the past will tell their tales—if you know how to speak their language."
—Savra
cards.originalText: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"A touch of vine sap in the blood, and the flesh knits as quickly as new roots twining."
—Freyalise
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Rhox
cards.text:
You may have Rhox assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: It's as solid as the club in its hand—and about as subtle.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText:
You may have Rhox deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Root Maze
cards.text: Artifacts and lands enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: Pause for the briefest of moments to consider the whorl of brambles, the tangled twist of bark, and the maze has already won.
cards.originalText: Artifacts and lands come into play tapped.

cards.name: Rootwalla
cards.text: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.

rulings.text: If this card's ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can't activate its ability that turn.

cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Rushwood Dryad
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: To a dryad, every tree in the forest is both a doorway and a window.

foreignNames.name: ラッシュウッドのドライアド

cards.originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Scion of the Wild
cards.text: Scion of the Wild's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
cards.flavor: It has a hundred thousand extinctions to avenge.
cards.originalText: Scion of the Wild's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Seedborn Muse
cards.text: Untap all permanents you control during each other player's untap step.
cards.flavor:
"Her voice is the wilderness, savage and pure."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

rulings.text: Other effects can prevent a permanent from untapping during an untap step. You do need to look carefully, however, as many effects say that the permanent does not untap during its controller's untap step, and this card's ability occurs during other players' untap steps. If a card does say this, then Seedborn Muse can untap it. But some other abilities are not written this way and can still prevent a card from untapping.
All your permanents untap during each other player's untap step. You have no choice about what untaps.

cards.originalText: Untap all permanents you control during each other player's untap step.

cards.name: Skyshroud Ranger
cards.text: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: Not even the elves truly know the Skyshroud Forest. The rangers are merely the best equipped to handle its uncertainty.

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

foreignNames.name: スカイシュラウドのレインジャー

cards.originalText: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand into play. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Spined Wurm
cards.flavor: Its spines act like the teeth of a saw, scoring distinctive marks in the vegetation of its territory.

cards.name: Stalking Tiger
cards.text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: In the Jamuraan jungles, there is often no separating beauty from danger.
cards.originalText: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.name: Stampeding Wildebeests
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The most violent and destructive storms in Femeref occur on cloudless days.

rulings.text: The ability that returns a creature doesn't target anything. You can return a creature with shroud or protection from green, for example. You don't decide which creature to return until the ability resolves. If you control no other green creatures, you must return Stampeding Wildebeests itself.
You choose a creature and return it all during resolution of the triggered ability. This means that if you have two Wildebeests, there is no way to end up returning only one creature.

cards.originalText:
Trample (If this creature would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sylvan Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.
cards.flavor:
"We're not sure what one looks like, so to be safe, nobody look at anything until we're out of here."
—Parbold Drix, veteran explorer
cards.originalText: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.

cards.name: Sylvan Scrying
cards.text: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: One glimpse of an elf's home lasts her weeks away in the wild.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Tangle Spider
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Only rumors have ever escaped its web.
cards.originalText:
Flash (You may play this spell any time you could play an instant.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Treetop Bracers
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Gravity is truly what you make of it.

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block a creature enchanted with this.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Troll Ascetic
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.
cards.flavor: It's no coincidence that the oldest trolls are also the angriest.
cards.originalText:
Troll Ascetic can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Upwelling
cards.text: Players don't lose unspent mana as steps and phases end.
cards.flavor: Freyalise promised a dawn that would never end, a day of limitless life. As many dread her promise as revere it.

rulings.text: Players can keep mana in their pool indefinitely while this is on the battlefield, but once it leaves the battlefield, they have until the end of the current step (or phase) to use the mana before it disappears.

cards.originalText: Mana pools don't empty at the end of phases or turns. (This effect stops mana burn.)

cards.name: Verdant Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.
Verdant Force's ability triggers at the beginning of each upkeep, not just each of your upkeeps.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play under your control.

cards.name: Viridian Shaman
cards.text: When Viridian Shaman enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: She stands as a living symbol of the natural world and an enemy of the forces that threaten it.

foreignNames.name: ヴィリジアンのシャーマン

cards.originalText: When Viridian Shaman comes into play, destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Wall of Wood
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor: Orcish lumberjacks spent the night sharpening their blades and resting for a day of labor. They awoke to find that the forest had been making its own preparations.
cards.originalText: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

cards.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
cards.text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.

foreignNames.name: ヤヴィマヤの女魔術師

cards.originalText: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment in play.

cards.name: Angel's Feather
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a white spell.

If a player casts a white spell, Angel's Feather's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Angel's Feather's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a white spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Bottle Gnomes
cards.text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Reinforcements . . . or refreshments?
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Chimeric Staff
cards.text: {X}: Chimeric Staff becomes an X/X Construct artifact creature until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The staff unraveled in a chaotic chorus of clanging, becoming an improbable beast of hissing blades.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

If Chimeric Staff is already an artifact creature when you activate its ability, Chimeric Staff stays an artifact creature but the ability resets its creature types. You always apply the effect from this card before counters or other effects that modify power and toughness. For example, if you pay {3} to make it a 3/3, then someone gives it -1/-1, it will be a 2/2. If you then activate the ability with {4}, you will apply the "4/4" effect before the -1/-1 effect, so the end result will be a 3/3. Damage that was dealt to the creature stays on it.

cards.originalText: {X}: Chimeric Staff becomes an X/X Construct artifact creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Chromatic Star
cards.text:
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chromatic Star: Add one mana of any color.
When Chromatic Star is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.originalText:
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chromatic Star: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
When Chromatic Star is put into a graveyard from play, draw a card.

cards.name: Citanul Flute
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost X or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Each note of the flute mimics the call of a different beast.

rulings.text: X can be zero if you want.
You look in your library but you do not have to choose a creature even if you have one that meets the criteria.

foreignNames.name: シタヌールのフルート

cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost X or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
cards.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

cards.originalText: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature in play that shares a creature type with it. (For example, if a Goblin Warrior, a Goblin Scout, and a Zombie Goblin are in play, each gets +2/+2.)

cards.name: Colossus of Sardia
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor: Buried under a thin layer of dirt, it was known for centuries as Mount Sardia.

rulings.text: The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

cards.originalText:
Trample (If this creature would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Composite Golem
cards.text: Sacrifice Composite Golem: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}.
cards.flavor: An artificer's experiment in cross-material engineering found its own purpose as an interpreter between cultures.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Composite Golem: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Crucible of Worlds
cards.text: You may play land cards from your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Amidst the darkest ashes grow the strongest seeds.

rulings.text: Crucible of Worlds doesn't change the times when you can play those land cards. You can still play only one land per turn, and only during your main phase when you have priority and the stack is empty.
Crucible of Worlds doesn't allow you to activate abilities (such as cycling) of land cards in your graveyard.

cards.originalText: You may play land cards from your graveyard.

cards.name: Demon's Horn
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a black spell.
If a player casts a black spell, Demon's Horn's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Demon's Horn's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a black spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Doubling Cube
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Double the amount of each type of unspent mana you have.
cards.flavor: The cube's surface is pockmarked with jagged runes that seem to shift when unobserved.

rulings.text: Doubling Cube's ability is a mana ability.
The "type" of mana is its color, or lack thereof (if the mana is colorless).

Any restrictions on the mana in your mana pool aren't copied. For example, if you have {C}{W}{W}{B} with no restrictions on it in your mana pool and {U}{U}{U} that can be used only to cast artifact spells, you'll end up with {C}{C}{W}{W}{W}{W}{B}{B}, {U}{U}{U} that can be used only to cast artifact spells, and {U}{U}{U} that can be used for anything.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Double the amount of each type of mana in your mana pool.

cards.name: Dragon's Claw
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a red spell.
If a player casts a red spell, Dragon's Claw's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Dragon's Claw's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a red spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Fountain of Youth
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Some say the fountain's waters are the first rains that fell over Dominaria.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: The Hive
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor:
"Their buzzing makes my bones hum from a mile away."
—Galenti, treasure hunter
cards.originalText: {5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp into play. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.

rulings.text: If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws a card.

cards.name: Icy Manipulator
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: In fire there is the spark of chaos and destruction, the seed of life. In ice there is perfect tranquility, perfect order, and the silence of death.

rulings.text: Once a player announces that they're casting a spell or activating an ability, no player may take other actions until the spell or ability has been paid for. Notably, other players can't try to tap that player's permanents to stop them from paying {T} or to stop them from producing enough mana.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each combat if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.flavor: Built with neither a way to steer nor a way to stop, the juggernauts were simply aimed at an enemy's best defenses and told to charge.

rulings.text: If Juggernaut can't attack for any reason (such as being tapped or having come under that player's control that turn), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having it attack, its controller isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.name: Kraken's Eye
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a blue spell.
If a player casts a blue spell, Kraken's Eye's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Kraken's Eye's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Legacy Weapon
cards.text:
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Exile target permanent.
If Legacy Weapon would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Legacy Weapon and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.
cards.originalText:
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Remove target permanent from the game.
If Legacy Weapon would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Legacy Weapon and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

cards.name: Leonin Scimitar
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor:
"Every scratch tells a story, and every notch has a name. Four generations have held this blade. You shall not disappoint them."
—Initiation of Laena, skyhunter
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Loxodon Warhammer
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink.
Equip {3}
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has lifelink and trample. (When it deals damage, you gain that much life. If it would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Mantis Engine
cards.text:
{2}: Mantis Engine gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{2}: Mantis Engine gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"It's a clever design. You should look closely at its gearing after it swallows your head."
—Jhoira, master artificer
cards.originalText:
{2}: Mantis Engine gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{2}: Mantis Engine gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

rulings.text: Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Mind Stone
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Mind Stone: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Not by age but by capacity is wisdom gained."
—Titus Maccius Plautus, Trinummus
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Mind Stone: Draw a card.

cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"It has been my honor to improve on the Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."
—Urza, in his apprenticeship
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Phyrexian Vault
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"The secrets of Phyrexia are expensive. You will pay in brass and bone, steel and sinew."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.

cards.name: Pithing Needle
cards.text:
As Pithing Needle enters the battlefield, choose a card name.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.

rulings.text: Pithing Needle affects cards regardless of what zone they're in. This includes cards in hand, cards in the graveyard, and exiled cards. For example, a player can't cycle Eternal Dragon or return an Eternal Dragon from their graveyard to hand if Pithing Needle naming Eternal Dragon is on the battlefield.
You can name any card, even if that card doesn't normally have an activated ability. You can't name a token unless that token has the same name as a card.
If you name a card that has both a mana ability and another activated ability, the mana ability can be activated but the other ability can't be activated.
Once Pithing Needle has left the battlefield, activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can be activated again.
Activated abilities include a colon and are written in the form "[cost]: [effect]." Triggered abilities and static abilities of the named card work normally.

cards.originalText:
As Pithing Needle comes into play, name a card.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be played unless they're mana abilities.

cards.name: Platinum Angel
cards.text:
Flying
You can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.
cards.flavor: In its heart lies the secret of immortality.

rulings.text: Effects that say the game is a draw, such as the _Legends_(TM) card Divine Intervention, are not affected by Platinum Angel. They'll still work.

You can concede a game while Platinum Angel on the battlefield. A concession causes you to leave the game, which then causes you to lose the game (Once you concede, you no longer control a Platinum Angel, so its ability can't prevent you from losing the game).

No game effect can cause you to lose the game or cause any opponent to win the game while you control Platinum Angel. It doesn't matter whether you have 0 or less life, you're forced to draw a card while your library is empty, you have ten or more poison counters, you're dealt combat damage by Phage the Untouchable, your opponent has Mortal Combat with twenty or more creature cards in their graveyard, or so on. You keep playing.

Other circumstances can still cause you to lose the game, however. You will lose a game if you concede, if you're penalized with a Game Loss or a Match Loss during a sanctioned tournament due to a DCI rules infraction, or if your _Magic Online_(R) game clock runs out of time.
If you control Platinum Angel in a Two-Headed Giant game, your team can't lose the game and the opposing team can't win the game.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
You can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.

cards.name: Razormane Masticore
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Razormane Masticore unless you discard a card.
At the beginning of your draw step, you may have Razormane Masticore deal 3 damage to target creature.

foreignNames.name: 剃刀毛のマスティコア

cards.originalText:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Razormane Masticore unless you discard a card.
At the beginning of your draw step, you may have Razormane Masticore deal 3 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Sculpting Steel
cards.text: You may have Sculpting Steel enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: An artificer once dropped one in a vault full of coins. She has yet to find it.

rulings.text: Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied artifact will trigger when Sculpting Steel enters the battlefield. Any "as enters the battlefield" or "enters the battlefield with" abilities of the chosen artifact will also work. For example, if Sculpting Steel copies an artifact creature with sunburst, the copy will get +1/+1 counters based on the number of different colors of mana used to pay Sculpting Steel's total cost. If Sculpting Steel copies a noncreature artifact with sunburst, the copy will get charge counters based on the number of different colors of mana used to pay Sculpting Steel's total cost.

Sculpting Steel doesn't copy whether the original artifact is tapped or untapped. It also doesn't copy any counters on that artifact, any Auras or Equipment attached to that artifact, or any effects that are currently affecting that artifact — you get exactly what's printed on the chosen card and nothing more. So if you copy an animated Chimeric Staff, for example, you get a normal, nonanimated Chimeric Staff.

If the chosen artifact is copying something else (for example, if the chosen artifact is another Sculpting Steel), then your Sculpting Steel enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen artifact copied.

If the chosen artifact is a token, your Sculpting Steel copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield. Your Sculpting Steel is not considered to be a token.
You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Sculpting Steel stays on the battlefield as an artifact that doesn't do much of anything.

cards.originalText: As Sculpting Steel comes into play, you may choose an artifact in play. If you do, Sculpting Steel comes into play as a copy of that artifact.

cards.name: Spellbook
cards.text: You have no maximum hand size.
cards.flavor:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Spellbook onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText: You have no maximum hand size.

cards.name: Steel Golem
cards.text: You can't cast creature spells.
cards.flavor:
"Once you create perfection, what else is there to make?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

rulings.text: You can put creatures onto the battlefield by means other than casting them.
Yes, this only affects you.
A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: You can't play creature spells.

cards.text:
Equipped creature can't be blocked and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {2}
cards.flavor: Such cloaks are in high demand both by assassins and by those who fear them.
cards.originalText:

cards.flavor: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a green spell.
If a player casts a green spell, Wurm's Tooth's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Wurm's Tooth's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a green spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Faerie Conclave
cards.text:
Faerie Conclave enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}.
{1}{U}: Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue Faerie creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
Faerie Conclave comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}: Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue Faerie creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
